Package org.securecryptoconfig

Class SCCKey

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.securecryptoconfig.SCCKey
  • public class SCCKey
extends java.lang.Object
    Class representing a container of a key used for cryptography operations like symmetric or asymmetric encryption.

    SCCKey contains a byte[] representation of a key as well as different parameters like the type (SCCKey.KeyType) and the used algorithm for key creation.

    A new SCCKey for performing a cryptographic use case can be created with the method createKey(KeyUseCase).
    E.g. creating a key for symmetric encryption: 
     {
        @code
        SCCKey key = SCCKey.createKey(KeyUseCase.SymmetricEncryption);
 }
    Choose a suitable SCCKey.KeyUseCase for key creation. For doing asymmetric encryption use SCCKey.KeyUseCase.AsymmetricEncryption.
    For doing symmetric encryption SCCKey.KeyUseCase.SymmetricEncryption.
    For Signing SCCKey.KeyUseCase.Signing

    Alternatively when performing symmetric encryption it is also possible to create a key derived from a password with createSymmetricKeyWithPassword(byte[]): 
     {
        @code
        SCCKey key = SCCKey.createSymmetricKeyWithPassword(password);
 }
    Also it is possible to create a SCCKey from already existing SCCKey byte[] with createFromExistingKey(byte[]): 
     
 SCCKey key = SCCKey.createFromExistingKey(existingSCCKey)

    • Constructor Detail

      • SCCKey

        protected SCCKey​(SCCKey.KeyType type,
                 byte[] publicKey,
                 byte[] privateKey,
                 java.lang.String algorithm)
        Constructor which gets the SCCKey.KeyType, the byte[] representation of the public and private key and the algorithm of its creation. This constructor is used in for SCCKeys of SCCKey.KeyType.Asymmetric. If a new SCCKey should be created call createKey(KeyUseCase).
        Parameters:
        type - : choice of SCCKey.KeyType
        publicKey - : byte[] representation of public key
        privateKey - : byte[] representation of private key
        algorithm - : used for key creation

    • Method Detail

      • getKeyType

        public SCCKey.KeyType getKeyType()
        Get SCCKey.KeyType of SCCKey. A key can either be SCCKey.KeyType.Symmetric or SCCKey.KeyType.Asymmetric. According to its type a key can be used for different cryptographic use cases.
        Returns:
        SCCKey.KeyType

      • getAlgorithm

        public java.lang.String getAlgorithm()
        Returns the algorithm used for key generation.
        Returns:
        String: algorithm used for key generation

      • toBytes

        public byte[] toBytes()
               throws SCCException
        Get byte[] representation of SCCKey.
        Returns:
        byte[]: returns byte[] representation of key in case that the key has SCCKey.KeyType.Symmetric
        Throws:
        SCCException

      • createKey

        public static SCCKey createKey​(SCCKey.KeyUseCase useCase)
                        throws SCCException
        Create a key for a specific SCCKey.KeyUseCase.

        Depending of specified SCCKey.KeyUseCase the resulting SCCKey can be used for different provided methods.

        A new SCCKey for performing a cryptographic use case can be created with the method createKey(KeyUseCase).
        E.g. creating a key for symmetric encryption: 
         {
        @code
        SCCKey key = SCCKey.createKey(KeyUseCase.SymmetricEncryption);
 }
        Choose a suitable SCCKey.KeyUseCase for key creation. For doing asymmetric encryption use SCCKey.KeyUseCase.AsymmetricEncryption.
        For doing symmetric encryption SCCKey.KeyUseCase.SymmetricEncryption.
        For Signing SCCKey.KeyUseCase.Signing

        Alternatively when performing symmetric encryption it is also possible to create a key derived from a password with createSymmetricKeyWithPassword(byte[]): 
         {
        @code
        SCCKey key = SCCKey.createSymmetricKeyWithPassword(password);
 }
        Also it is possible to create a SCCKey from already existing SCCKey byte[] with createFromExistingKey(byte[]): 
         
 SCCKey key = SCCKey.createFromExistingKey(existingSCCKey)
        Parameters:
        useCase - : for which Scenario is the key needed? Give a value of SCCKey.KeyUseCase
        Returns:
        SCCKey: key that can be used for the specified use case
        Throws:
        SCCException

      • createSymmetricKeyWithPassword

        public static SCCKey createSymmetricKeyWithPassword​(byte[] password)
                                             throws SCCException
        Creation of key derived from a given password that can be used for symmetric encryption based on Secure Crypto Config file.
        This can be done as follows: 
         {
        @code
        SCCKey key = SCCKey.createSymmetricKeyWithPassword(passwordBytes);
 }
        Also it is possible to create a SCCKey from already existing SCCKey byte[] with createFromExistingKey(byte[]): 
         
 SCCKey key = SCCKey.createFromExistingKey(existingSCCKey)
        Parameters:
        password - : as byte[]
        Returns:
        SCCKey
        Throws:
        SCCException

      • createSymmetricKeyWithPassword

        public static SCCKey createSymmetricKeyWithPassword​(PlaintextContainer password)
                                             throws SCCException
        Creation of key derived from a given password that can be used for symmetric encryption based on Secure Crypto Config file.
        This can be done as follows: 
         {
        @code
        SCCKey key = SCCKey.createSymmetricKeyWithPassword(passwordString);
 }
        Parameters:
        password - : as PlaintextContainer
        Returns:
        SCCKey
        Throws:
        SCCException

      • decodeObjectToBytes

        public byte[] decodeObjectToBytes()
        Still work in progress!

        TODO still needs to be adapted
        Method for decoding the SCCKey object to a byte[] representation.

        This byte[] can be used to restore a SCCKey object later again with the method createFromExistingKey(byte[]). 
         
 	SCCKey key = SCCKey.createFromExistingKey(existingSCCKey)
        Returns:
        byte[]: representation of SCCKey object

      • createFromExistingKey

        public static SCCKey createFromExistingKey​(byte[] existingSCCKey)
        Still work in progress!

        TODO still needs to be adapted
        Method to create a SCCKey object out of a existing byte[] SCCKey representation.

        A byte[] representation of a SCCKey object can created by calling decodeObjectToBytes() on the corresponding SCCKey object.
        Parameters:
        existingSCCKey - : byte[] representation of a SCCKey object
        Returns:
        SCCKey
